intro: Pseudocyclosorus qingchengensis, commonly known as the Qingchengensis water fern, is a rare aquatic plant native to China. It belongs to the family Marsileaceae and is characterized by its small, floating leaves that often form a rosette shape. The plant has a complex reproductive system, producing both sexual and asexual propagules. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments with abundant sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
